title: Japanese satellite order puts GEO market on par with 2023
summary: A communications satellite order from Japan’s flagship operator has brought the geostationary orbit market back to par with last year.

title: Rocket Lab launches first of back-to-back missions for NASA
summary: Rocket Lab launched the Ready, Aim, PREFIRE mission for NASA over the weekend from Launch Complex 1 on the Mahia Peninsula in...

title: Colossus processor gains flight heritage
summary: Space computing startup Colossus has gained flight heritage for Kestrel, a processor built to operate in orbit.

title: How privacy-preserving technology can advance satellite collision detection
summary: Since no one group controls space, the open sharing of space situational awareness (SSA) data is critical to ensure safe space operations.

title: Deep Blue Aerospace secures fresh funding ahead of first orbital launch
summary: Chinese rocket company Deep Blue Aerospace has secured new funding for its reusable rocket plans, with its first launch set for later this year.

title: Launch Roundup: North Korean launch failure, Starliner CFT, EarthCARE
summary: As the month of May transitions into June, a European Space Agency (ESA) mission to study the Earth’s clouds and aerosols as well as a Russian cargo ship to resupply the International Space Station (ISS) are both on this week’s docket of launches. Two Starlink and three Chinese satellite launch missions are also scheduled, as well as the repeatedly delayed Boeing Starliner crewed flight test (CFT) mission. What’s more, North Korea attempted a launch early this week, however, the launch ultimately ended in failure.

title: ESA and SpaceX Prepare to Launch EarthCARE
summary: The European Space Agency (ESA) and SpaceX are preparing to launch the long-anticipated EarthCARE mission on May 27, 2024, set to improve climate models and weather forecasts by studying Earth’s radiation budget in new detail. EarthCARE’s studies are split into three main domains: Clouds, Aerosols, and Radiation. By characterizing these three components and their interactions, EarthCARE hopes to provide a new enhanced data set to dramatically improve models of our planet’s climate and weather.

title: SpaceX announces next Starship test flight date
summary: SpaceX is targeting June 5th for the fourth flight test of its massive Starship rocket, pending approval from the Federal Aviation Administration....

title: Chinese firm files plans for 10,000-satellite constellation
summary: A Chinese firm linked to commercial rocket maker Landspace has filed a notification with the ITU for a constellation comprising 10,000 satellites.

title: Satellogic lays off 13% of workforce
summary: Commercial imaging company Satellogic has laid off 13% of its workforce as the company continues its efforts to reduce costs and seek new business from the U.S. government.
